In the past I have used the instructions in the documentation to maintain my own update site mirror on my LAN.  Along with a policy file this lets me update users via the LAN.

http://help.eclipse.org/help32/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/misc/update_standalone.html

First off, in 3.3, I cannot find a startup.jar file as is needed in these docs.  So I used 3.2 and it's startup JAR to mirror the DSDP update site.  Specifically, this command:

java -cp startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -application org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -command mirror -from http://download.eclipse.org/dsdp/tm/updates/milestones -to C:\tm_mirror

This all runs OK.  However, if I try to install anything from this local mirror.  The install bombs out near the end of the process with the following error:


java.lang.SecurityException: SHA1 digest error for META-INF/eclipse.inf

	at java.util.jar.JarVerifier.processEntry(Unknown Source)

It seems like there are potentially a couple of problems here:

1) 3.3 documentation is wrong in terms of reference to startup.jar.  This does not seem to exist in 3.3.

2) Why does the error itself happen in the first place?
DJ, what should be the new instructions now that startup.jar is not used?

The direct 3.3 equivalent would be: 
java -cp plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.<VERSION>.jar org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main -application
org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -command mirror -from
http://download.eclipse.org/dsdp/tm/updates/milestones -to C:\tm_mirror

This works also:
java -jar plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.<VERSION>.jar -applic...

However, is there any reason why the eclipse executable couldn't be used:
eclipse -nosplash -application ...
or maybe on windows: eclipsec -nosplash -application ...

I tried the idea of using eclipsec.exe (I almost had tried that myself).  Anyway, using that approach the mirror worked, and it also resolved the problem during the install from the mirror with the SHA1 dighest.

So it looks like updating the docs is the main thing to do for the release.
The SHA1 error likely was from using 3.2, there was a bug or two fixed in 3.3 that caused "corrupted" eclipse.inf files.
Documentation references to startup.jar have been updated for 3.3.
